gov.anl.ipns.Util.File
Class RobustFileFilter

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter
      gov.anl.ipns.Util.File.RobustFileFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.FileFilter, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
StateFileFilter
public class RobustFileFilter
extends javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter
implements java.io.Serializable, java.io.FileFilter

This class adds additional functionality to Java's FileFilter In addition to completing the methods that are abstract in FileFilter, it adds the capabilities to automatically ensure that the desired extension is put on the file name, as well as adding several other convenience methods. It holds the valid extensions (such as .jpg) in a String array. The filtered extensions may be lowercase or uppercase, although lowercase is preferred.

See Also:

getPreferredExtension

public java.lang.String getPreferredExtension()
Returns the preferred extension for this FileFilter. Defaults to first extension in the list.

Returns:
String containing the preferred extension, including leading '.'. Returns null if the extension list is empty.

appendExtension

public final java.lang.String appendExtension(java.lang.String filename)
This method changes a File extension by changing the File name itself. This is pretty much only useful if you want to be sure that your files are being saved with the correct extension when you are saving a new File.

Parameters:
filename - The name to append the extension to.
Returns:
The filename with the extension appended to it.

setDescription

public final void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
Sets the description for this FileFilter.

Parameters:
desc - The description for this FileFilter.

addExtension

public final void addExtension(java.lang.String ext)
Adds an extension to the list of extensions for this FileFilter. The extension is converted to lower case before being stored.

Parameters:
ext - The extension to add to this FileFilter's list of extensions. A '.' is automatically prepended if the extension does not have one.

setExtensionList

public final void setExtensionList(java.util.Vector extList)
Sets the extension list for this FileFilter. Useful if you want to quickly add lots of extensions. The extensions area converted to lower case before being stored.

Parameters:
extList - The Vector of extensions (Strings) to add to this FileFilter. A '.' is automatically prepended to each extension if it does not have one.
